data.name: Can Kenji
data.description:
Can Kenji is a restaurant inspired by the traditional Japanese taverns, the Izakayas. The way to eat in an Izayaka is to ask for different dishes to share among the diners. 

In Can Kenji, people can eat traditional dishes that are rarely part of the menus in other Japanese restaurants in the West and they will also enjoy reinterpretations of more conventional dishes within Japanese and Mediterranean cuisines.

The restaurant is small and quiet. It would seem that someone has decided to slow down the time to enjoy the stay without hurry, where the order in which they ask for and consume the dishes no longer matter and, where the experience of eating, becomes an original tapas tasting that will not leave anyone indifferent.

data.name: Granja & Chocolateria La Nena
data.description:
Since 2003, La Nena, in Gr√°cia, has conquered the hearts of the grandmothers, mothers and children of Barcelona with its chocolate a la taza, its melindros, cakes and cookies made in its Obrador.

In the chocolate shop, in addition to enjoying breakfast, lunch or a snack, you can find a corner for children with toys, books and games for all ages.

In response to demand, they have created a line of gluten-free products: bread, muffins, muffins and cakes.

For more information on schedules and reservations, consult its official website.

data.name: Sopa Barcelona
data.description:
In Sopa Barcelona, broths and seasonal vegetarian and vegan creams are the real protagonists. 

In their noon menu, diners will always find four soup options to make first. 

Some of them will be very familiar, like the pumpkin and carrot of a lifetime, and others not so much, like the Indian red-lentil dahl or the Japanese vegetable cream with miso.

data.name: Te√≤ric Taverna Gastron√≥mica
data.shortDescription: Te√≤ric's is a relaxed restaurant with Catalan cuisine and a creative touch. Ideal for groups, the decor combines light wood, exposed bricks, and curious casks.
data.description:
Te√≤ric's relaxed atmosphere, informal but bustling, make this restaurant an ideal place to go with a group of friends. 

The decoration of the restaurant combines light wood, exposed bricks and curious casks along the high ceilings.

Its menu is based on Catalan cuisine with a creative touch, complemented with some external recommendations. They work with seasonal products, proximity and taking maximum care of the relation quality/price.

data.name: A Clandestine Dinner Party
data.description:
Join the latest culinary trend of immersive and social dining where local hosts invite you into their homes for a magical meal.

DAME is an old warehouse designed to honour the speakeasies of the nationwide alcohol prohibition in the USA. The combination of the secretive venue and the innovative menu is bound to surprise you! Your host, Mario, offers a tasting menu of dishes from across the peninsula, paired with different wines. A chef full of inspiration, his menu and wine pairing change weekly. It is upbeat, creative and exciting. From the decoration and mood lighting, to seasonal ingredients and food presentation, this is nothing less than a high quality experience. Please note that for groups smaller than 10 people, the price can change. Click on "Privatize and customise the event" to get a personalised offer.

√Äsia amb Gr√†cia has the best Asian food at the best price in Barcelona.

For those looking for an economical option to taste the best sushi and the best dishes of Asian cuisine, this is your place.

data.description: Positive impact fashion for men and women at 42 of the Carrer Verdi, in the district of Gr√†cia. Organic fabrics, local production, recycling and decent work are some of the pillars on which this project fashion, where you can also buy jewelry, accessories and cosmetics is based.

data.name: Olokuti
data.description:
Olokuti is an establishment with more than 3,000 products summarized in 4 concepts:

- Ecological
- Biological
- Fair Trade
- Local products, closeness

Barcelona has two stores, one in the Centro Comercial Las Arenas (Spain Square), and one in Asturias Calle de Gr√†cia.

Local de Gr√†cia has a special charm. Located in the basement of a house over a hundred years old, with high ceilings, tiled floors with beautiful hidra√∫licas, and various rooms for which're going to go all the establishment. There are products for the whole family: clothing, accessories, books, music and cosmetics. We went straight to the children's area, full of colorful clothes, stuffed animals and toys for children aged 0-12 years.

Children's clothing has been designed by the leading brands of infant clothing craft, all trade justo.La vast majority of children's products are based on organic fabrics and responsible production (organic cotton production following ecological and social criteria). The area of ‚Äã‚Äãshort stories and children's books is complete, both Castilian and Catalan.

In another "room" we can find healthy food from fair trade. In the back there is access to the inner courtyard of the house. In the vending machine you serve water, coffee, teas, juices it or bio soft drinks, which take in the garden outside. The garden is small oasis with wrought iron tables surrounded by plants and trees almost centenarians. Wonderful to go with children and a quiet drink at the outdoor. In the garden of Olokuti organize free children's activities as storytelling (from May, when better weather).

You can find out full information on their activities on their website.

data.description: Opened in 1888, the ‚ÄòMarket of Liberty‚Äô was covered over in 1893 by Francesc Berenguer i Mestres (1866‚Äì1914), Gaud√≠‚Äôs long-time assistant, in typically fizzy Modernista style, employing generous whirls of wrought iron. It received a considerable facelift in 2009 but remains emblematic of the Gr√†cia district: full of life and fabulous fresh produce.

You find a wide variety of garments and feminine brands based on ethics and respect for the environment. They also have online shop, so the location is not an excuse!

data.name: Coshop Barcelona
data.description: Created in July 2012, Coshop is the first collaborative fashion and accessories shop in Catalonia. Its space, located at number 4 Calle Asturias (Gr√†cia, Barcelona), serves as a showcase for various designers and brands to share their philosophy of social and environmental responsibility. They have recently entered the ranking of sustainable shopping Luxiders, the largest in Europe.

data.name: Casa Comalat
data.description:
Like a tribute to Gaud√≠, the Casa Comalat contains many elements of Gaud√≠'s architecture, and is one of the most original examples of home-grown art nouveau in Barcelona: modernisme. Two distinct fa√ßades, both of them showing the influence of the curve redolent of the work of the Reus-born maestro, arouse our curiosity to go and take a closer look at this beautiful and unique building.

The architect Salvador Valeri i Pupurull worked on the Casa Comalat from 1909 to 1911, and was clearly influenced by Gaudi's organic forms. Dating from the final phase of the "modernista" era, this is a highly original building comprising two fa√ßades with a common element: the Gaudiesque curve. The main fa√ßade, which overlooks Barcelona's Avinguda Diagonal, is made of stone and is more symmetrical and regular in shape. 

At street level, there is an interesting wrought-iron doorway and, above it, a central gallery surmounted by a pinnacle. At the top, a series of openings cut into the fa√ßade and surrounded by stone garlands jut out above the remaining curved balconies with their floral motifs.

Casa Comalat is another of the jewels of Catalan modernism that you can visit in the city of Barcelona.

El tipo narra la historia de un polic√≠a que, por casualidad, conoce una chica en la pausa de su trabajo y se obsesiona con ella. Confunde amor con obsesi√≥n. La sigue en las redes sociales, lee los libros que ella lee y canta las canciones que a ella le gustan. Todo desde la soledad de su casa y sus pensamientos.

data.name: Capitol de Vietnam
data.description:
The Chac family runs several Vietnamese restaurants in Barcelona. 

One of them is A Capitol of Vietnam, which mixes tradition and modernity and offers, as always, the best of the cuisine of their native country at very affordable prices.

data.name: Kibuka
data.description:
Japanese cuisine with a clear western influence that is committed to a good quality / price ratio. 

The Kibuka Goya menu stands out for its sushi cut at the moment and for an extensive and original variety in makis.

data.name: Granja Petitbo
data.description:
Granja Petitbo is a vintage-style restaurant-cafeteria located in the Passeig de Sant Joan. 

In the beginning of the 20th century it was a cowshed, and now Granja Petitbo has transformed int a bakery/bistrot

In their menu, diners can find homemade dishes made with fresh products, cooked slowly and with care: sandwiches, salads, quiches, pancakes and poached eggs, among others. 

It is ideal for breakfast, lunch, snack, dinner or brunch on the weekend.

data.name: Restaurante La Pepita
data.description:
Small and charming, La Pepita is a small tapas bar in the heart of Barcelona.

With an informal style and a small family team, it has the atmosphere and the menu of a traditional tapas bar. Fun, dynamic, casual and above all accessible to everyone.

A menu with classic tapas and others reinvented, always with a personal and creative touch, with the illusion and joy intact.

data.name: Restaurant Embat
data.shortDescription: Cozy restaurant in Barcelona's Eixample with a focus on Catalan cuisine and fresh, seasonal ingredients. One of the first 'bistronomics' in the city.
data.description:
This cozy restaurant at the heart of Barcelona‚Äôs Eixample quarter is ‚Äã‚Äãlocated on the ground floor of a modernist building on Mallorca street. 

It opened its doors more than a decade ago, becoming one of the first ‚Äòbistronomics‚Äô in the city. 

Embat is an a la carte restaurant with the lunch menu changing weekly (from Monday to Friday). Its cuisine is  based on the Catalan tradition, with an emphasis on simplicity and quality. Always, looking for fresh and seasonal produce to offer dishes suitable for each season of the year.

data.name: Restaurant Gut
data.description:
This vintage restaurant is designed with conscience, good music and a good palate.

Gut's cuisine is a fusion between Mediterranean cuisine and Asian, with specialties such as Mediterranean Burrito heura, coral tartare with mango or grilled octopus with potato salad. They offer gluten-free and vegetarian options.

Gut's philosophy is to offer a restaurant where to eat well, but also to offer new flavors, textures and sensations. In short, to make the five senses enjoy.

data.name: Restaurante Pepa Tomate
data.description:
Young, friendly and informal, Pepa Tomate has been one of the most popular restaurants in the Gracia neighborhood since its inauguration at the end of 2012. 

Behind its success are the tapas, dishes and traditional dishes of the young chef Pau Corderas - prepared with care and local products - and the charming interior design of this small open space throughout the day.

data.name: Gaudim
data.shortDescription: Gaudim in Barcelona offers a unique dining experience, blending Mediterranean cuisine with Japanese influences. Don't miss their seafood paella and Kobe/Wagyu meats. A must-visit restaurant for foodies. For reservations and prices, check their website.
data.description:
Gaudim welcomes you to an unparalleled dining experience in Barcelona. Its history began in 2013, the year in which it was proposed as a first-class Catalan hostelry. The tranquility of the atmosphere, mixed with high-quality service and exquisite dishes made it gain fame among local diners. Its art-filled space highlights the philosophy with which the restaurant conceives each of its dishes. 

The menu is known for fusing classic Mediterranean cuisine with Japanese touches that give it an innovative and experimental style. Tradition is modernized at Gaudim. Among its most outstanding dishes are seafood paella, tuna tartar, and delicious Kobe and Wagyu meats.

The restaurant also has a small hall of fame in which treasures related to some of the most famous diners who have passed through its tables are collected, from FC Barcelona jerseys to baseballs. The restaurant is ready to surprise you with every detail.

For more information on reservations and prices, check their official website.

data.name: Casa Lle√≥ Morera
data.description:
The architect Llu√≠s Dom√®nech i Montaner was commissioned by Francesca Morera i Ortiz to work on the Lle√≥ i Morera House in 1902. On Passeig de Gr√†cia, 35 (Barcelona) there was an old building, called Casa Rocamora, built in 1864 by master builder Joaquim Sitjas. Llu√≠s Dom√®nech i Montaner designed a complete remodel of the existing house using a variety of materials. The project lasted until 1906.

Francesca Morera i Ortiz inherited that building from her uncle, Antoni Morera i Bus√≥, but she died before seeing the finished work. It was her son, Albert Lle√≥ i Morera, who took charge of the house, giving it the name by which it is known today, Casa Lle√≥ i Morera.

Llu√≠s Dom√®nech i Montaner remodeled the previous building, making it a truly modernist work of art. The house‚Äôs owner commissioned him to demolish and rebuild the fa√ßade, add three galleries and stone balconies on the different floors, and to design the interior. In order to complete this modernist piece of work, the architect was surrounded by a large group of master artists and craftsmen who were renowned for their creativity, like the sculptor Eusebi Arnau, mosaicist Mario Maragliano and cabinetmaker Gaspar Homar, among others.

The fa√ßade and the mezzanine were decorated with different types of ornamentation, of which the sculptures by Eusebi Arnau depicting two couples of female figures were the most notable, although they were destroyed in a remodel of the house's ground floor in 1943. On the fa√ßade are repeated allusions to the family's surname Morera (which means mulberry in English) represented through the use of different materials, and symbols of 20th century inventions. The fa√ßade is crowned by a tempietto that exceeds the height permitted by the Barcelona City Council, so the builders had to ask for the necessary construction permit.

An explosion of modernism is found in the interior, which is one of the best preserved in the city: stained-glass windows, mosaics, ceramics, sculpture, wood, marble, sgraffito... The vestibule and staircase show us the different modernist applied arts that the artists and craftsmen were able to create based on the architect's ideas and instructions.

data.name: Sant Joan
data.shortDescription: Sant Joan festival in Catalonia celebrates the summer solstice with bonfires, fireworks, parties, and traditional dishes. A time for family and friends to come together and enjoy the festivities.
data.description:
Sant Joan is a festival that celebrates the summer solstice and is one of the most important festivals in Catalonia.

The festival is celebrated with bonfires, fireworks, and parties throughout the night, and is a time for family and friends to come together and enjoy the festivities.

The festival is also known for its traditional foods, such as coca de Sant Joan, a sweet pastry, and cava, a sparkling wine.

The festival has its roots in pagan traditions and has been celebrated in Catalonia for centuries.

data.name: Casa Batll√≥
data.shortDescription: Casa Batll√≥, Gaud√≠'s masterpiece in Barcelona, is a UNESCO World Heritage site. Its stunning facade and imaginative interior make it a must-visit.
data.description:
Casa Batll√≥ stands as one of Antoni Gaud√≠'s most significant masterpieces, earning its rightful place on the UNESCO World Heritage list since 2005. Originally constructed in 1875, it underwent a remarkable transformation in 1903 when it was purchased by a wealthy Barcelona businessman named Josep Batll√≥. Recognizing Gaud√≠'s architectural prowess, Batll√≥ entrusted him with a renovation project that spanned from 1904 to 1906.

The original essence of the building is most pronounced in its facade, adorned with mosaics that blend stone, glass, and vibrant ceramics. Notably, its nine-iron balconies sport a whimsical, mask-like design. As for the interior, every nook of the house is a testament to artistic ingenuity and imaginative flair. It exudes a remarkable brightness and a riot of colors that truly captivate the senses. Don't miss the opportunity to ascend to the roof, which resembles the scales of a dragon, earning Casa Batll√≥ the affectionate nickname, "the house of the dragon."

Historically, Casa Batll√≥ served as both the Batll√≥ family's residence and featured apartments for rent. Since 2002, it has opened its doors to the public, regularly hosting events throughout the year.

Casa Batll√≥ is hailed as a jewel of modernism and one of Gaud√≠'s most original creations, making it an absolute must-visit during your Barcelona sojourn. For information on visiting hours, ticket prices, and upcoming events, please visit its official website.

data.name: Tapies. The Footprint of Zen
data.description: Exhibition focused on the interest of Antoni T√†pies for the work of some Japanese monks of the eighteenth and nineteenth centuries who were transmitters of the teachings of Zen Buddhism, and who developed a critical attitude and a willingness to disrupt the scale of conventional values - including those of artistic practice - such as Hakuin, Sengai, Jiun, Tori, Rengetsu. The exhibition will show how T√†pies integrated many of the attitudes, images and techniques used by these artists into his language, and into the Western tradition that belonged to him. It is not a process of mimesis, but of assimilation of a way of working, and also of a vision of the world that the Japanese tradition has managed to preserve in temples and gardens, poems and calligraphies, ceramics and paintings.

data.name: The Egyptian Museum
data.description:
The Egyptian Museum of Barcelona is an institution of cultural and educational interest that aims to bring its visitors closer to the life, society and customs of one of the oldest civilizations in history.
This is a center specialized in ancient and Egyptian art and archeology.
The museum is endowed with facilities of 2,000 square meters along which ten thematic sections extend that show different facets of Egyptian civilization, from its aspects in daily life in society to the figure of the pharaoh, mummification and the worship of the gods.

The museum's permanent collection exceeds 1,200 pieces and is located on the upper floors of the museum, while temporary exhibitions related to ancient art are held on the lower floor.
The Egyptian museum offers guided, educational tours and workshops for children. He also conducts dramatized night tours for fans of the world of ancient Egypt.
For more information on schedules, prices and activities, consult its official website.

data.name: Casa Amatller
data.shortDescription: Casa Amatller is a remarkable modernist treasure in Barcelona with intricate details reflecting the owner's passions. Don't miss the original Amatller Chocolate recipe!
data.description:
Casa Amatller stands as one of Barcelona's remarkable modernist architectural treasures, a creation by the visionary architect Josep Puig i Cadafalch. This architectural marvel was commissioned by the Amatller family, renowned for their involvement in the chocolate industry.

Though the building's origins trace back to 1875, it wasn't until 1898 that Antoni Amatller acquired it to transform it into his residence, which he occupied until his passing in 1910. His daughter, Teresa Amatller, continued to call this house home until her own passing. Eventually, the property was entrusted to the Fundaci√≥n Instituto Amatller de Arte Hisp√°nico. In March 2015, it was opened to the public, becoming the Amatller House Museum.

Casa Amatller's transformation marked the birth of modernist architecture along Paseo de Graci√†, revolutionizing the cityscape. The house's interior and exterior are adorned with intricate details reflecting the owner's three primary passions: collecting, photography, and travel.

Throughout the residence, priceless works of art collected during the owner's global travels grace the space. In 1990, pioneering features for the era‚Äîsuch as an elevator and electric lighting‚Äîwere installed, demonstrating the commitment to modernity.

This section of Paseo de Graci√† is famously known as the "Manzana de la Discordia" (Block of Discord), where a trio of modernist masterpieces graces the same fa√ßade: Casa Batll√≥ by Antoni Gaud√≠, Casa Amatller by Josep Puig i Cadafalch, and Casa Lle√≥ Morera by Llu√≠s Dom√®nech i Montaner. These architectural gems vie for the title of the most beautiful, a nod to the Greek mythology tale where goddesses competed to possess the golden apple of beauty.

Casa Amatller stands as a modernist jewel that should not be overlooked during your visit to the city. Be sure to drop by the caf√© for a taste of Amatller Chocolate's original recipe. For details on visiting hours and pricing, please refer to their official website.

data.name: Paseo de Graci√†
data.shortDescription: Paseo de Graci√† in Barcelona is a famous avenue known for its modernist architecture, luxury shops, and vibrant cultural scene.
data.description:
Paseo de Graci√† in Barcelona is possibly the best-known avenue in the city. With a 1.5 km length, it begins in Pla√ßa de Catalunya and ends in Jardinets de Graci√†.

Until the 16th century, it was an area far from the city and with little population. It was not until the 17th century when it began to develop continuously with the construction of manor houses of the bourgeoisie or convents. Later, the arrival of the industrial revolution favoured the growth of the area due to the installation of many factories. Thus, over the centuries this area grew and became part of the city of Barcelona in 1897 due to the large population that began to live here.

Paseo de Graci√† is today one of the most cosmopolitan and attractive neighbourhoods in the city, full of life with cultural and artistic activities. Besides being an exclusive area of ‚Äã‚Äãluxury shops, restaurants and bars, it has great historical value and importance.

Paseo de Graci√† shows Catalan modernism in every corner. In this avenue are located Casa Lle√≥ Morera, Casa Amatller, Casa Batll√≥ and Casa Mil√°, the jewels of modernist architecture of the time. Also, the benches, street lamps, gardens, or the paving of the ground have surprising modernist decorative elements that can be discovered while strolling and wandering through its streets full of history and art.

data.name: Casa Mil√†
data.shortDescription: Casa Mil√°, the last civil work of architect Antonio Gaud√≠, is a stunning residential building with a unique stone fa√ßade and iconic balconies. Don't miss the rooftop terrace and Gaud√≠ exhibition. UNESCO World Heritage Site since 1984. #Barcelona #architecture
data.description:
This is the last civil work the architect Antonio Gaud√≠ carried out between 1906 and 1912.

Like the Batll√≥ house, the construction was commissioned by the Mil√† family with the idea of ‚Äã‚Äãbeing a residential building for rent. The family lived on the main floor. Following his style, Gaud√≠ created a building whose fa√ßade seems to be in motion, imitating the waves of the sea. Also called "La Pedrera" for its stone fa√ßade, its 32 balconies made of scrap metal stand out, which was a groundbreaking material for the contemporary architecture at the time in Spain.
Regarding interior decoration, it is also Gaud√≠'s work. Modernist style furniture, typical of the life of a bourgeois Barcelona family during the first third of the 20th century.

It is a total of six floors with a roof terrace. During your visit, you can enjoy an inside permanent exhibition of the work of the architect Gaud√≠. Or go up to the roof that will allow you to be amazed at the architecture and the views of the Paseo de Graci√†.

Casa Mil√° was declared a World Heritage Site by UNESCO in 1984 and without a doubt a must-see on your visit to the city of Barcelona.

data.name: Casa Sayrach
data.description:
One of the last modernista buildings in Barcelona stands imposingly on the Avinguda Diagonal, and encapsulates everything the masters of the style had achieved in Barcelona. Graceful and elegant, its beauty lies in the understated curves of the fa√ßade.

This late-modernista building was erected on the corner between Carrer Enric Granados and the Avinguda Diagonal in 1918, when few architects were still working in this style. The project was signed by Gabriel Borrell, but it was builded by the architect and writer Manuel Sayrach, the son of the project developer. Sayrach hadn't completed his degree at the time he is thought to have devised this interesting building which reveals the clear influence of Gaud√≠ in the use of the curve.

The rounded corner of the building is surmounted by a slender turret. Another outstanding element is the protruding balcony with columns and large windows. Inside the building there is a lavishly decorated lobby and staircase.

data.shortDescription: The Festa Major de Gr√†cia in Barcelona is a vibrant week-long festival with colorful street decorations, concerts, traditional events, and fireworks.
data.description:
The Festa Major de Gr√†cia is a week-long festival celebrated in the Gracia district of Barcelona, Spain, from August 15 to 21. It is one of the most popular festivals in Barcelona, attracting over 2 million visitors each year.

The festival is known for its colorful street decorations, which are created by the residents of each street. The decorations are judged by a panel of experts, and the winning street is awarded the "Premi Ciutat de Barcelona".

In addition to the street decorations, the festival also features a variety of other activities, including concerts, dances, traditional Catalan events, and fireworks.

data.name: Barcelona Beer Festival
data.shortDescription: Barcelona Beer Festival: the world's beer capital for 3 days with 500 beers from around the world, show cooking, and tastings. Discover new craft beers!
data.description: The Barcelona Beer Festival is the most important annual craft beer festival in Southern Europe. For three days, it becomes the world's beer capital with a large number of activities and visitors from all over the globe who come together to share the revolution that has put Barcelona on the gastronomic brewer map. The festival is dedicated to the culture of craft beer and offers thousands of attendees the chance to taste beers full of surprising flavors and aromas. The festival features more than 100 beer taps and offers up to 500 different beers from all over the world. The festival also features numerous activities such as show cooking, presentations, and beer tastings. If anyone is unsure of which beer to try amongst the vast array of offerings, there will be Beer Informers on hand to ask for help, providing advice to novices, based on what they are looking for and the flavors they like best. The festival is a unique opportunity to discover new brands and types of beer and to share great craft beer together

data.name: The Sopa Boba
data.description:
The Sopa Boba restaurant brings a modern and modern touch to the traditional recipes of Catalan and Mediterranean cuisine. 

The restaurant is located in the right Eixample of Barcelona, ‚Äã‚Äãin an informal place perfect for tapas and enjoy with friends.

data.name: Figaroburg
data.description:
Born in mid-2012, Eco Burger Figaro is a small venue that combines burger and cocktails. 

The burgers made with organic meat from Girona and various companions and condiments. 

Its central location and its contemporary, intimate and friendly design make it ideal for some dinner and first drink one night before leaving for Barcelona.

data.name: Restaurante Xavier Pellicer
data.description:
With dishes made with products of proximity, Xavier Pellicer offers a menu based on eight seasonal vegetables, with three food options: vegetarian, vegan or animal proteins.

The neuralgic point of the restaurant is the spectacular kitchen and long bar, where the diners will be able to visualize how the dishes are worked and elaborated, to make them feel a 100% gastronomic experience.

Among the novelties of Xavier Pellicer are the incorporation of the ember, undoubtedly noticeable in the dishes, the wok and the spices based on seasonal products and adapted to all kinds of diets and needs. Vegans and vegetarians will feel very comfortable here because Pellicer knows how to make the most of the flavors of the fruits of the garden. And this, without losing its healthy essence.

data.name: Palo Verde
data.shortDescription: Palo Verde is a charming Mediterranean grill restaurant, famed for its specialties like cal√ßots and gnocchi. Check their website for details.
data.description:
Palo Verde is a mediterranean restaurant that cooks on the grill. It is a small but charming place that ensures a pleasant evening. 

Among its specialties are cal√ßots, ricotta and romescu, maitake and gnocchi with lemon or the old cow meatball and cauliflower.

For more information on schedules and and reservations, consult its official website.

data.name: Pepito
data.description:
Pepito is the new trendy restaurant that bets on this popular snack as a specialty of the house, in its sophisticated version. 

Suitable for gourmets, the menu also includes salads, classic tapas, wood meats, tartar ... The charming space falls in love with a beautiful interior design.

data.name: Cerveseria Catalana
data.description:
From the same family as the also popular Ciudad Condal, the Cervecer√≠a Catalana is a tapas classic in Barcelona. 

The relation quality/price is excelent, as well as the service. Along with this, they offer a very varied menu, in which they highlight the top offers. 

It is always crowded, making reservations is recommended, which speaks in favor of the quality of its offer.

data.name: CocoVail Beer Hall - Craft Beer Barcelona
data.description:
CocoVail was born in August 2016 as a ‚Äúbeach culture‚Äù Americana Beer Hall. 

Before being Barcelona's first Beer Hall, the building was a textile factory from the 18th century.

With a great variety of handcrafted beers, live sports broadcasting and board games, Coco Vail is the perfect bar to spend some time with friends. Their chicken wings are the main hallmark of the house.

data.name: El Nacional
data.description:
El Nacional represents an innovative concept that will mark a turning point in culinary trends, a truly gastronomic experience. 

El Nacional is the first restaurant in Barcelona with different areas where we can try traditional recipes from around the Iberian Peninsula, prepared with high quality produce in unique surroundings. 

Located at the heart of Passeig de Gr√†cia, it reflects Barcelona's social and cultural life.

data.name: La Dama
data.description:
Located in a graceful and elegant building which hails from the Catalan art Nouveau era, La Dama is an amalgamation of traditional french cuisine with a private dining space and a creative cocktail bar.

Its decoration is really cosy, enabling guests to feel at home.

data.name: Thai Barcelona
data.description:
Its dishes are prepared on the spot following the gastronomic tradition of the ancient kingdom of Siam. 

The touches of modernity that define its style splash its menu, always faithful to the art of the Thai people, adapting it to the taste and preferences of its customers.

data.name: Petit Bangkok
data.description:
Petit Bangkok is surely one of the best Thai restaurants in Barcelona. 

With a new location since the end of 2012 and run by a Catalan-Thai couple, the restaurant offers excellent and authentic Thai home cooking at unbeatable prices.

data.name: Pau	Claris 190
data.shortDescription: Pau Claris 190 is a cozy restaurant in Barcelona offering a modern twist on Catalan cuisine, with tapas, salads, entrees, and homemade desserts.
data.description:
Pau Claris 190 is a gastronomic delight located in the heart of Barcelona. 

The restaurant offers a modern take on traditional Catalan cuisine, with a menu that features an array of dishes made with local ingredients. The atmosphere is cozy and inviting, and the service is friendly and attentive. The menu features a variety of tapas, salads, and entrees, as well as a selection of fine wines. The restaurant also offers a range of desserts, including a selection of homemade ice creams. 

Pau Claris 190 is the perfect place to enjoy a delicious meal in a relaxed and comfortable setting.

For more information on reservations and prices, consult its official website.

data.name: Bar Betlem
data.description:
A vermouth, tapas, lunch and dinner, a good gintonic ... Betlem has what every moment of the day needs, as well as a flirtatious Parisian-style terrace.

Located in the right side of Barcelona, Bar Betlem offers a variety of tapas and bar food, as well as catering and take-away services. They work with the best seasonal product to present an excellent selection of tapas and dishes. 

The restaurant offers a reserved on the upper floor with a cozy table for small groups, between 4 and 10 people.

data.name: Windsor
data.shortDescription: Experience traditional Catalan cuisine with a modern twist at Windsor in Barcelona. Cozy atmosphere, delicious food, and an impressive wine list. A must-visit for a unique dining experience!
data.description:
Windsor in Barcelona is a charming restaurant that serves traditional Catalan cuisine with a modern twist. 

Located in the heart of the city, the restaurant offers a cozy atmosphere and a variety of dishes inspired by the region‚Äôs gastronomic heritage. The menu includes classic dishes such as paella, fideu√†, and fideu√† negra, as well as creative dishes like foie gras with quince jelly or white truffle risotto. The wine list is impressive, featuring some of the best wines from Catalonia and other regions. 

The friendly staff and delicious food make Windsor in Barcelona a must-visit destination for anyone looking for a unique dining experience.

For more information on reservations and prices, consult its official website.

data.name: Darvaza

Cozy atmosphere and friendly staff make it a perfect dining spot for any occasion. Reservations and prices on their official website.
data.description:
Darvaza in Barcelona is a gastronomic delight. 

Located in the heart of the city, this restaurant offers a unique blend of traditional Catalan and Mediterranean flavors. The menu features traditional dishes like paella, fideu√†, and seafood dishes, as well as creative takes on classic dishes like the 'Darvaza Burger' and 'Darvaza Fries'. The restaurant also offers a wide selection of wines, beers, and ciders to pair with your meal. The atmosphere is cozy and inviting, and the staff is friendly and attentive. 

Whether you're looking for a romantic evening or a family dinner, Darvaza is the perfect spot for a memorable dining experience.

For more information on reservations and prices, consult its official website.

data.name: YUBI
data.shortDescription: YUBI in Barcelona offers a one-of-a-kind dining experience, blending traditional Spanish cuisine with modern flavors and a constantly changing menu.
data.description:
For a one-of-a-kind dining experience in Barcelona, you have to visit YUBI. This restaurant blends traditional Spanish cuisine with modern flavors and techniques.

The menu is constantly changing, with dishes inspired by the season and using the freshest ingredients. The atmosphere is relaxed and inviting, with a cozy bar and a warm and welcoming staff. YUBI is the perfect spot for a romantic dinner or a night out with friends. The menu features traditional Spanish dishes like paella and tapas, as well as creative takes on classic dishes like the Yubi Burger and the Yubi Bowl. 

Whether you're looking for a cozy dinner or a night out on the town, YUBI is the perfect spot for a truly unique dining experience.

For more information on reservations and prices, consult its official website.

data.name: Tapas 2254
data.shortDescription: Tapas 2254 in Barcelona is a top eatery serving a fusion of tapas and desserts, showcasing a mix of French, Italian, and Spanish culinary techniques.
data.description:
Tapas, a beloved local classic, find a vibrant home at Tapas 2254, emerging as one of Barcelona's finest eateries of its kind. The menu seamlessly fuses tapas with signature desserts, spotlighting the cosmopolitan essence of local cuisine through a medley of French, Italian, and Spanish culinary techniques.

Chef Nuncio Cona embarked on a culinary odyssey that traversed the 2254 kilometers separating Palermo from Barcelona. This journey led to the creation of a restaurant paying homage to the Mediterranean coastline, French culinary finesse, and Catalan tradition. Cona's unique reinterpretation of these cuisines has earned Tapas 2254 the coveted Tripadvisor's Travellers' Choice award in 2022, establishing it as one of the city's most captivating culinary destinations.

For comprehensive details on reservations and pricing, please visit their official website.

data.name: Vivo Tapas Restaurante Cocteler√≠a
data.shortDescription: Vivo Tapas: Barcelona's special restaurant combining delicious tapas, live music, and exclusive cocktails. Experience creativity and flavors in an elegant atmosphere.
data.description:
Vivo Tapas is a very special restaurant in Barcelona. They combine dinners with daily events, live music and the most exclusive cocktails.

The creativity, flavor and delicacy of its tapas and dishes is the result of years of experience. The fresh products with which they cook, their affection and professionalism and the creativity of their menu are the hallmarks of Vivo Tapas.

Their cozy atmosphere, with a modern and elegant decoration, falls in line with the distinguished area of ‚Äã‚ÄãBarcelona in which they are located (Rossell√≥ 255).

data.name: The 30 are the new ones... Go to hell!
data.description:
The 30 are the new ones... Go to shit!, Jorge Santos' show, arrives in Bilbao for the first time.

After two years on the Madrid billboard and passing through Seville, Malaga, Ciudad - Real and Barcelona visit the capital of Bizkaia.

Having a partner, buying a house, having children... Life is hard enough for you to accumulate tasks.

In this comedy show, Jorge Santos reviews the different screens that must be overcome to complete "The Game of 30". And he also talks a lot about sex, but that's not because of the crisis of the 30's... that brings him standard.

If you have, have had, or intend to be over 30, this is your show. A key guide to navigating this decade.

data.name: GENESIS, an immersive show about the first three days of Earth's creation, arrives in Barcelona
data.description:
Barcelona will premiere in the middle of this month a very special and great immersive experience to enjoy with the family, GENESIS, the story of the creation of the Earth and the reinterpretation of what could happen in those first three days of life, of explosion of light, air, water, vegetation with all its grandeur, vividness and color, accompanied by the best music. After having passed through Milan, London, Madrid or Marseille, he will now settle in the church of the Dominiques Barcelona School, from April 12 to July 7, 2024.
Genesis takes to a spectacular church in Barcelona an immersive light show where you will relive the history of creation from a totally new perspective. An abstract homage to the blue planet that places visitors on the first day of existence and miraculously transports them through time. Lights, music and high-performance projections will flood the walls and ceiling of the space, enveloping you in an incomparable journey at the beginning of everything.

Are you interested in this plan?

data.name: Luis de Arquer: Solo Chopin in Barcelona
data.description:
Explore the beauty of piano music at El Teatre m√©s Petit del M√≥n in Barcelona, where masterworks from Frederic Chopin come to life in this incredible performance.

Solo Chopin, is the tribute of the pianist and composer Luis de Arquer to Fr√©d√©ric Chopin, a piano recital that immerses us in some of the most beautiful works of his music, which even after more than 200 years, is still as close to our emotions as then thanks to its great beauty, romanticism and sensitivity. The Teatre m√©s Petit del M√≥n, is one more of those small halls where Chopin himself preferred to appear before a brief and select audience, where it was possible that singular communion that is lived through each sound‚Ä¶

data.name: Restaurante Boca Grande
data.description:
Bocagrande's exquisite combination of light, smells and textures create an exclusive, sophisticated, magical atmosphere, but also, why not, a bit of a bandit.

To the good service it is necessary to add the quality of the kitchen, with products of proximity, where fish and seafood are its distinctive feature. 

Its wine cellar is one of its many highlights, the place where the lovers of the good wine and the champagne will be able to touch the sky.

data.name: Botafumeiro
data.description:
Founded in 1975, Botafumeiro is one of the most emblematic and select seafood restaurants in Barcelona.

It offers the best and freshest product of the Cantabrian and Mediterranean in a distinguished environments. Their cuisine is the victory of unmatched tradition and freshness.

The restaurant is distributed in several rooms ideal for couples, families, businesses and counts with a majestic bar.

data.name: 9 Reinas
data.shortDescription: 9 Reinas brings the flavors of Argentina to Barcelona with exceptional meats and cozy ambiance. Don't miss the veal Milanese and dulce de leche pancake.
data.description:
9 Reinas brings a slice of Argentina to Barcelona, celebrating the essence of Latin American culinary artistry. This restaurant, nestled in the city center, has earned a stellar reputation for its unwavering commitment to quality and exceptional customer service.

The spotlight here shines brightly on meats, harmonizing with an intimate, cozy, and inviting ambiance. 9 Reinas boasts a grill that showcases top-tier meat cuts, accentuating their rustic essence and tantalizing aroma.

Begin your Argentine culinary journey with empanadas, a quintessential starter that beckons you into the world of Argentine flavors. The veal Milanese is a standout dish, distinguished by its meticulous preparation, ensuring each bite delivers tender meat beneath a satisfyingly crunchy coating. Should pasta beckon your palate, the grilled roasted chicken lasagna with Parmesan cream will undoubtedly be your trusted companion. To conclude your gastronomic voyage, indulge in a delectable dulce de leche pancake.

For detailed information regarding reservations and pricing, kindly refer to their official website.
